intro: Archemora fendleri, commonly known as the desert hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its woody stems and large, showy flowers that bloom in shades of yellow and red. The plant has thick, fleshy leaves that help it conserve water in its harsh environment. It produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Archemora fendleri is adapted to extreme temperatures and low rainfall, making it a resilient species in desert ecosystems.
